page.title: 15ELECTRICITY AND WATER
page.content: {1915 They had paraffin lamps and candles which they went to bed with. The Parish Council put street lights in for winter use. A man had to fill them every day with oil. They had to get water from the well. The lavatory was at the bottom of the garden and had to be emptied. {1925 They had candles and a big paraffin lamp in the middle of the table where they did sewing and school lessons. They had to get water from a well but a standpipe was put in across the road in about 1925. On Sunday night they had to carry water back for the washing the next day. The lavatory was at the top of the garden. You had to take a lantern because it was so dark. You could hear the people in next door's lavatory.
